text:
I am still frustrated that we don’t have either: the julia version stored in the Manifest.toml
Or `Manifest.1_0_5.toml` , `Manifest.1_5_3.toml` , etc.
it is so annoying that if I want to version control  a Manifest for a application that I want to know we are making conscious changes to the versions, that if someone mistakenly checks in a Manifest generated with 1.6, then CI running julia 1.5 will explode with a confusing error message.
(and there is no way at all that i can make CI work for multiple julia versions using Manifests)

example of where i want to version control a Manifest:
<https://github.com/JuliaDiff/juliadiff.github.io/pull/14>

text: You can put `if VERSION != version_you_want; error(); end` or something at the application entrypoint

elements.text: or something at the application entrypoint

text: Surprising to me too. It was especially bad when artifacts were still new.
